article.headline: LIU Brooklyn 80, Sacred Heart 65
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- James Williams scored 20 and hit a career-high six three-pointers as Long Island University beat Sacred Heart 80-65 Saturday. It was the fourth straight loss for the Pioneers (9-12, 6-6 Northeast Conference.) Sacred Heart took an early 10-6 lead on a three-pointer from Tavio Hobson, but LIU (7-12, 4-6 NEC) tied it 14-14 with two free throws from Aubin Scott with 9:59 to play. Williams hit three three-pointers in the first seven minutes of the second half to extend a 36-30 halftime lead to 53-38. Scott finished with 15 points for the Blackbirds, who have won three of their last four. Randy Jones had 14, including 8 of 8 from the free throw line. Kellen Allen had a game-high 11 rebounds. Kibwe Trim, the leading scorer in the NEC, finished with a game high 25 points for Sacred Heart. Hobson and Drew Shubik had 10 points each. Brice Brooks had a career high 10 rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
